snippet: Analysts said China’s notably slower growth in the second quarter of the year demonstrated Beijing’s new commitment to overhauling the economy.
abstract: National Bureau of Statistics reports that China's economy grew by 7.5 percent in second quarter, lackluster result that underlines effect of economic overhaul.

byline.original: By BETTINA WASSENER and CHRIS BUCKLEY

lead_paragraph: Analysts said China’s notably slower growth in the second quarter of the year demonstrated Beijing’s new commitment to overhauling the economy.

headline.main: China’s G.D.P. Growth Slows as Government Changes Gears
headline.print_headline: China’s G.D.P. Growth Slows as Government Changes Gears
